title: AAI ATC JE Full Test 2
instruction:
General Instructions


The Test contain 5 Sections having total 120 Questions.Each question has 4 options out of which only one is correct.You have to finish the test in 120 minutes.

You will be awarded 1 mark for each correct answer and there is no negative marking.

Once you start the test, you will not be allowed to reattempt it. Make sure that you complete the test before you submit the test and/or close the browser.

quiz.text:
Find the part of the given sentence that has an error in it. If there is no error, choose ‘No error’.

My cousins are smarter (1)/, when it come (2)/ to winning an argument (3)/.No error (4)
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is '2'.

Key Points

  • The error lies in the second part of the sentence in the usage of the verb 'come'.
  • The subject of the clause 'when it come to winning an argument' is 'it', which is a singular pronoun.
  • The pronouns he, she and it take a singular verb while you, we and they take a plural verb.
  • Thus, to make the verb 'come' singular Add an “s” to the verb if the subject is third-person singular.
  • Correct sentence: My cousins are smarter, when it comes to winning an argument.


Hence, the correct answer is option (4).

quiz.text:
Direction: Choose the word which is most nearly the SAME in meaning as the word is underlined.

The customs official beckoned the woman to his counter.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Called.'

Key Points 

  • The word 'Beckoned' means to show somebody with a movement of your finger or hand that you want him/her to come closer, or call.
  • ('Beckoned'  शब्द का अर्थ है इशारे से पास बुलाना​।) 
    • ​Example: She beckoned me over to speak to her.
  • Let us see the meanings of the given options:
    • Sent: to make something go or be taken somewhere, especially by mail, radio, etc. (कहीं कुछ भेजना या भिजवाना (विशेषतः डाक, रेडियो आदि के द्वारा))
    • Acquitted: to state formally that a person is not guilty of a crime. (किसी के निर्दोष होने की विधिवत घोषणा करना)
    • Called: cry out to (someone) in order to summon them or attract their attention. (ऊँची आवाज़ में बुलाना, पुकारना, चिल्‍लाना (प्रायः ध्यान आकर्षित करने के लिए, बुलाना))
    • Accused: to say that somebody has done something wrong or broken the law. (किसी व्‍यक्ति पर कुछ गलत करने का आरोप लगाना; क़ानून तोड़ने का दोषी ठहराना)
  • From the meanings of the given words, we can say that the word 'called' is the one that best expresses the meaning of the given word 'beckoned.'

quiz.text:
Fill in the blank with the most appropriate choice

Another kid might be _______ or repentant or maybe subdued.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "contrite."

Key Points

  • Let us understand the meaning of the given words:
    • "Craven" means contemptibly lacking in courage; cowardly.
      • Example: He cravenly fled from the scene.
    • "Contrite" means being ashamed about something wrong that you have said or done; remorseful.
      • Example: She seemed genuinely contrite when she apologized.
    • "Copious" means plentiful, ample or in large amounts.
      • Example: They drank copious amounts of wine.
    • "Convoluted" means (an argument, story or sentence) extremely complicated and difficult to follow.
      • Example: His grammar explanations are terribly convoluted.
  • In the given sentence, the word "repentant" means feeling sorry for something that you have done.
  • Thus, in the sentence, the correct word to be used is "contrite" to match the context of the sentence.

Hence, the correct answer is option 2.

quiz.text:
In the following question, out of the given four alternatives, select the alternative which best expresses the meaning of the Idiom/Phrase.

Point the finger at someone
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'To blame someone'.

Key Points 

  • 'Point the finger at someone' is an idiom that means to accuse or blame (someone).
    • ​Example - He was quick to point a finger at his coworkers.
  • So, 'to blame someone' is the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
  • Hence, option 1 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate ‘one word' for the expressions given below.

A group of guns or missile launchers operated together at one place.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'battery'.

Key Points 

  • The word 'battery' refers to a group of guns or missile launchers operated together at one place.
    • Example: "a battery of cannon from the Revolutionary War"
  • Hence, the most appropriate 'one word ' for the expression 'A group of guns or missile launchers operated together at one place' is 'battery'.

Therefore, the correct answer is Option 4.

Additional Information 

  • cemetery: a large burial ground, especially one not in a churchyard.
  • skittery: restless; skittish.
  • psaltery: musical instrument having plucked strings of gut, horsehair, or metal stretched across a flat soundboard, often trapezoidal but also rectangular, triangular, or wing-shaped.

quiz.text:
Rearrange the parts of the sentence in the correct order.

P: political, and social institutions

Q: in intellectual and artistic endeavours, the

R: Romans achieved greatness in their military,

S: unlike the Greeks, who excelled
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'SQRP'.

Key Points

  • S will be the first sentence of the sequence as it contains the subject 'The Greeks'.
  • Q will be the second sentence of the sequence as it mentions that the Greeks excelled in intellectual and artistic endeavours.
  • R will be the third sentence of the sequence as it states that the Romans achieved greatness in their military political and social institutions.
  • P will be the last sentence of the sequence as it states the Romans achieved greatness in their military political and social institutions.
  • Thus, the correct sequence is 'SQRP'.


Hence, the correct answer is option (3).

quiz.text:
Direction: Identify the option that rearranges the given jumbled words and corretly fills in the blank. 

The first atomic bomb of _________ of The Fat Man Bomb of the US.

copy/ Soviet Union / direct / the / a / was
options: (A) the Soviet Union a direct was copy
(B) a direct copy the Soviet Union was
(C) a was direct copy the Soviet Union
(D) the Soviet Union was a direct copy
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'the Soviet Union was a direct copy.'

Key Points

  • While arranging the parts of the sentence given in options, we have to find some grammatical or contextual connections between them, so let’s find out.
  • In this sentence, we can see that there are different parts like Subject, verb, conjunction, and continuation of the object.
  • The first part should be "the Soviet Union" as we can see that the preposition "of" is present before the blank and the preposition is used before a noun, pronoun, or noun phrase to show direction, time, place, location, spatial relationships, or to introduce an object.
    • Here we need to introduce the object "the Soviet Union" with the help of the preposition "of."
  • The next part must be "was" as it is a "be verb" that should be used after the noun 'the Soviet Union.'
  • The next part must be the phrase "direct copy" as it can be used as an indirect object in the sentence.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Option 4.
    ​

​​Correct sentence: The first atomic bomb of the Soviet Union was a direct copy of The Fat Man Bomb of the US.

quiz.text:
A sentence has been given with a blank to be filled with an appropriate word. Choose the correct alternative.

He, my siblings, and I ________ not going to the wedding.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'are'.

Key Points

  • When the subject of a sentence is composed of two or more nouns or pronouns connected by and, use a plural verb.
    • Example - She and her friends are at the fair.
  • The given sentence consists of three pronouns 'He', 'My siblings' and 'I'.
  • Thus, the appropriate word to fill in the blank is 'are'.


Hence, the correct answer is option (3).

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate SYNONYM of the underlined word to fill in the blank.

The musician's performance was so captivating that it left the audience feeling ___________ and energized.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "charmed"

Key Points

  • Let's take a look at the given words:
    • Captivating: capable of attracting and holding interest; charming
      • Sentence: She gave a captivating dance performance.
    • Depressed: feeling sad and without hope
      • Sentence: The depressed patient needed help to overcome their depression.
    • Charmed: feeling pleased and attracted
      • Sentence: The charmed audience was left wanting more.
    • Disappoint: to fail to meet the expectations of
      • Sentence: The disappointing performance left the audience feeling let down.
    • Offended: feeling upset or annoyed by something that is said or done
      • Sentence: The offended audience left early in protest.
  • From the given meanings and examples, we can conclude that "depressed," "disappoint," and "offended" are not synonyms for "Captivating."
  • Thus, option 2: charmed is the correct synonym.

The correct sentence is: "The musician's performance was so captivating that it left the audience feeling charmed and energized."

Hinglish

  • Captivating: आकर्षण और रुचि हासिल करने योग्य; मंजिला
  • ​Depressed: दुखी और आशा न होने वाला
  • Charmed: सुखी और आकर्षित महसूस होना
  • Disappoint: अपेक्षाओं से नहीं मिलना
  • Offended: कुछ बोले जाने या किये जाने से उत्सुक या घिनौना होना
  • दिए गए अर्थ और उदाहरणों से हम निश्चित हो सकते हैं कि "depressed," "disappoint," और "offended" "Captivating" के समानार्थी शब्द नहीं हैं।
  • इसलिए, charmed सही समानार्थी शब्द है।.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word to fill in the blank.

Despite the division they faced, the team remained ___________ and worked together to achieve their goals.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "unified"

Key Points

  • Let's take a look at the given words:
    • Division: disagreement between two or more groups, typically producing tension or hostility.
      • Sentence: The British was responsible for spreading seeds of division in India.
    • Reduction: the act of reducing or the state of being reduced
      • Sentence: The reduction in staff caused concern among the employees.
    • Segmentation: the act of dividing into segments or the state of being divided
      • Sentence: The segmentation of the market allowed for targeted advertising.
    • Unified: brought together; united
      • Sentence: The unified team worked together to achieve their goals.
    • Severance: the act of severing or the state of being severed
      • Sentence: The severance of the relationship was a difficult decision.
  • From the given meanings and examples, we can conclude that "reduction," "segmentation," and "severance" are not antonyms for "division."
  • Thus, option 3: unified is the correct antonym.

The correct sentence is: "Despite the division they faced, the team remained unified and worked together to achieve their goals."

Hinglish

  • Division: दो या अधिक समूहों के बीच असहमति, आमतौर पर तनाव या हैंडिकोट उत्पन्न करता है। 
  • Reduction: कम करना या कम होना की स्थिति
  • Segmentation: हिस्सों में विभाजन या हिस्सों में विभाजित होने का क्रिया
  • Unified: समेत; एकत्रित
  • Severance: टूटना या टूटे हुए होना की स्थिति
  • दिए गए अर्थ और उदाहरणों से हम निश्चित हो सकते हैं कि "reduction," "segmentation," और "severance" "division" के विलोम शब्द नहीं हैं।
  • इसलिए, unified  सही विलोम शब्द है।

quiz.text:
Select the grammatically correct form of the following sentence from the options below:

I'm sorry, but I shouldn't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have plans.
options: (A) I'm sorry, but I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have an plans.
(B) I'm sorry, but I couldn't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have plans.
(C) I'm sorry, but I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have a plans.
(D) I'm sorry, but I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have plans.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "I'm sorry, but I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have plans."

Key Points

  • The grammatically correct form of the sentence is option 4: "I'm sorry, but I can't attend the meeting tomorrow because I already have plans."
  • In this sentence, "I" is the subject, and "can't attend the meeting tomorrow" is the verb phrase.
  • The verb "attend" is conjugated in the negative form "can't" to indicate that the speaker is unable to attend the meeting.
  • The phrase "because I already have plans" is a subordinate clause that gives the reason for the speaker's inability to attend the meeting.
  • The subject of the subordinate clause is "I" and the verb is "have."
  • The object of the verb "have" is "plans," which refers to the speaker's other commitments or obligations.
  • Option 1 is incorrect because it uses the incorrect article "a" with the noun "plans."
  • Option 2 is incorrect because it uses the incorrect verb "couldn't" instead of the correct verb "can't."
  • Option 3 is incorrect because it uses the incorrect article "a" and the incorrect noun "plan" instead of no article with the noun "plans."

Thus, option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Choose the option that is the future continuous tense form of the following sentence:

They are waiting for the band at the concert.
options: (A) They wait for the band at the concert.
(B) They have waited for the band at the concert.
(C) They will be waiting for the band at the concert.
(D) They will wait for the band at the concert.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "They will be waiting for the band at the concert."

Key Points

  • The future continuous tense is used to describe an action that will be happening at a specific time in the future. It is formed using the auxiliary verb "will" and the present participle of the main verb (-ing form).
  • In the sentence "They will be waiting for the band at the concert," the verb "will be waiting" is in the future continuous tense. It describes an action (waiting for the band) that will be happening at a specific time in the future (at the concert).
  • Option 1) "They wait for the band at the concert" is in the present tense, which describes an action that is happening now.
  • Option 2) "They have waited for the band at the concert" is in the present perfect tense, which describes an action that was completed at some point in the past and may still have an impact on the present.
  • Option 4) "They will wait for the band at the concert" is in the future tense, which describes an action that will happen at a specific time in the future.

Thus, option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Find the part of the given sentence that has an error in it. If there is no error then choose 'no error' (choose 4).

If I had known (1)/that she was in New York (2)/I will have met her (3)/.No error (4)
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is '3'.

Key Points

  • In the first segment 'If I had known' the verb (had known) is in the past perfect tense form.
  • In the second segment 'that she was in New York' the linking verb (was) is the past tense indicative form of 'be'. 
  • In the third segment 'I will have met her' is in the future perfect tense form. 
  • Since the other two segments are in the past tense form, it is logical that the third segment should also be in the past tense form. 
  • Hence the error lies in part 3 of the sentence. 
  • So, option 2 is the correct answer. 
  • We can correct the sentence by using the past tense form of will which is would- 'I would have met her'.

Correct sentence - If I had known (1)/that she was in New York (2)/I would have met her (3)/.

quiz.text:
Directions: Below in each question, some sentences are given, find the sentence which is not really contributing to the main theme and OUT of the passage or find the odd sentence and rearrange the remaining sentences to make a coherent paragraph.

(A) Dozens more were missing.

(B) The deaths occurred in the cities of Guaruja, Santos and Sao Vicente of Sao Paulo state, with the former hardest hit, according to a statement from its civil defence office.

(C) The ban led to plummeting trade volumes and exchanges shutting their businesses.

(D)  The office estimates 200 people have been displaced in Guaruja.

(E) A storm that pummeled Brazil’s south-eastern coast early Tuesday caused landslides and killed at least 16 people.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "C"

Key Points

How to attempt:

  • In this type of question, take a bird's eye view, find out the common theme which is described in all the statements, and rearrange the jumbled-up sentences. The statement which does not contribute to the main theme of the passage needs to be kept out.
  • After going through all the given five sentences, we can easily mark sentence C as the odd one because it is talking about businesses but this whole paragraph is about landslides and casualties.
  • EABD - This arrangement forms a coherent paragraph.

The complete paragraph is given below:

A storm that pummeled Brazil’s south-eastern coast early Tuesday caused landslides and killed at least 16 people. Dozens more were missing. The deaths occurred in the cities of Guaruja, Santos, and Sao Vicente of Sao Paulo state, with the former hardest hit, according to a statement from its civil defence office. The office estimates 200 people have been displaced in Guaruja.

quiz.text:
Identify the option that rearranges the given jumbled words and correctly fills in the blank.

Schizophrenia, a chronic mental disorder, ________ of the brain.

the / produced / premature / deterioration / by / is
options: (A) is produced by the premature deterioration
(B) is produced premature by the deterioration
(C) the deterioration produced premature by is
(D) premature deterioration produced is by the
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'is produced by the premature deterioration'

Key Points 

  • From the given statement and the options, it is clear that the blank needs to be filled by how the disease occurs.
  • We need to select the correct order of words from the given options that would fill the blank. 
  • The first phrase should be 'is produced' which shows how the disease occurs. Also, we need a helping verb after disorder.
  • The second phrase will be 'the premature deterioration' which tells the process that causes Schizophrenia.
  • Both parts are joined by the preposition 'by'. The first part is the action (verb) while the second part is the cause behind the action. 
  • So, we get the rearrangement as 'is produced by the premature deterioration'.
  • So, option 1 is the correct filler for the given blank. 
     

Correct sentence - Schizophrenia, a chronic mental disorder, is produced by the premature deterioration of the brain.

quiz.text:
Direction: Identify the option that rearranges the given jumbled words and correctly fills in the blank.

The ruins of ______ a hundred years later.

towns / Boscoreale / discovered / the / of / were
options: (A) Boscoreale towns of the were discovered
(B) were discovered Boscoreale towns of the
(C) the towns of Boscoreale were discovered
(D) discovered the towns were of Boscoreale
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is- 'the towns of Boscoreale were discovered.'

Key Points

  • While arranging the parts of the passage given in the options, we have to find some grammatical or contextual connections between them, so let’s find out.  
    • The opener will be "the towns" as it introduces the context of the sentence.
    • The word "towns" should be followed by a preposition "of."
    • The preposition "of" should be followed by the noun "Boscoreale."
    • The noun "Boscoreale" should be followed by "were discovered."
      ​

Correct sentence: The ruins of the towns of Boscoreale were discovered a hundred years later.
 

Additional Information             
 

  • Steps for solving Para Jumbles:
    • Clues include pronouns, like he, she, it, this, that, these, those; adverbs like formally, really; article a, an, and the; definers like actually, finally, another; connectors like but, yet, both, also and neither nor, or, however, nevertheless.
    • Now, with the help of clues, try to find out qualifier and qualified sentences, so that we can make pairs of qualified and qualifier sentences to eliminate the wrong choices given in the question.
    • After making pairs, start eliminating the wrong choices or options given in the question.
    • In case there is more than one choice, try to follow the sequence of sentences according to the occurrence of the events

quiz.text:
A sentence has been given with a blank to be filled with an appropriate word. Choose the correct alternative.

I can understand your situation right now, _________ we need to leave.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'but'.

Key Points

  • The given sentence has two independent clauses - 
    • Clause 1 - I can understand your situation right now,
    • Clause 2 - we need to leave.
  • These clauses are equal in importance but contrast with each other and need to be linked together with a coordinating conjunction. 
  • Off the given options only 'but' is a coordinating conjunction making it the appropriate word for the given blank. 
  • Hence, option 3 is the correct answer. 
     

Correct sentence - I can understand your situation right now, but we need to leave.

quiz.text:
The question below consists of a set of labelled sentences. Out of the four options given, select the most logical order of the sentences which form a paragraph.

The building's history begins in 1792, when a public competition was held to choose a design for a presidential residence in the new capital city of Washington.

P. Labourers, including local enslaved people, were housed in temporary huts built on the north side of the premises.

Q. The structure was to have three floors and more than 100 rooms and would be built in sandstone imported from quarries along Aquia Creek in Virginia.

R. Thomas Jefferson, later the country's third president (1801-09), using the pseudonymous initials "A.Z.," was among those who submitted drawings, but Irish American architect James Hoban won the commission (and a $500 prize) with his plan for a Georgian mansion in the Palladian style.

S. The cornerstone was laid on October 13, 1792.

They were joined by skilled stonemasons from Edinburgh, Scotland, in 1793.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'SRQP'.

Key Points

  • The first given sentence talks about the competition which was held to choose a design for a presidential residence in 1792.
  • Hence, the next sentence will be 'S' as it says a stone that forms the base of a corner of a building was laid on October 13, 1792.
  • Then the next sentence will give us information about the participants of the competition and the winner. It is given in 'R'. Hence, the next part will be 'R'.
  • The next sentence will be 'Q' as it is telling us about the structure of the new residence.
  • The next sentence will be 'P' as it is telling us about the staying location of the labourers after starting construction.

​Hence, the correct answer is Option 2.

quiz.text:
Read the given passage and answer the questions that follow.
Socialization is the lifetime process of acquiring and disseminating norms, conventions, and ideas. The use of social media has now become so important for the new generation that it has become an addiction that is difficult to recognize, so in this contrast, the older generation feels a sense of satisfaction and contentment at having been born in an era when something other than technology defined the social and recreational lives of the children of that time. We are attempting to become more socialized through media, yet the media is expanding, and individuals are essentially being trapped within a room. The younger generation entirely relies on social media. Social media is basically the primary source of getting information in the present scenario while in the 90’s newspapers were the primary source of information. Reading the newspaper is a habit that our parents have instilled in us. The primary source of reliable news was regarded as newspapers and television news. Doordarshan was the most famous and reliable TV channel in the 90’s, compared to the 24-hour news networks of today, which lack any meaningful content and are occupied with playing outside in the real world. Social media is basically an outcome of technological advancements.
 
Every technological advancement brings advantages along with disappointments. It is on the awareness of the users how advantages can be maximized, and disadvantages minimized. 90’s is the time when there was no Internet and single-screen theaters were common. So, circumstances at that point were not conducive to the growth of social media. Rotary landline phones were found in every home feature, phones were considered a luxury, and our identity was determined by what we did in the real world. The 90’s generation often feels an awkward generation gap with younger generations. Social media created a virtual world that runs parallel to the real world. In contrast, if we talk about socialization then there are two kinds of socialization that exist the one is real socialization and other is virtual socialization. Technological innovation brought with it the heat of change. A person who is able to adopt the stream of change will survive and advance in the future.
 
We molded ourselves with change in time and time advanced with technology. We also adapted to ourselves with changing technology and evolving social media life. Simple landlines advanced into cellular phones and it gives way to multimedia phones which ultimately culminated in the proliferation of smartphones. The origin of smartphones has given way to social media advancement.
Which of the followings were regarded as the primary source of reliable news during 90's?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'newspapers and television news'

Key Points

  • Let's explore the above options one by one with respect to our question:
  • Option (1) states that 'radio' was the primary source of reliable news. but it is nowhere mentioned in the passage.
  • Option 2  says that 'newspapers and television news' were regarded as the primary source of reliable news. which is true as it is mentioned in the passage.
  • Thus, this statement provides a solution to the problem expressed in the passage.
  • Options (3) and (4) are not in line with the given passage as it not mentioned in the passage.

​Hence, Option 2 is the correct answer.

options: (A) because they were born in 90's era
(B) because they had enough time to finish homework
(C) becuase something other than technology defined the lives of the children of that time
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'because something other than technology defined the lives of the children of that time'

Key Points

  • According to the passage, If we read the second line carefully 'the older generation feels a sense of satisfaction and contentment at having been born in an era when something other than technology defined the social and recreational lives of the children of that time.' It clearly hints that other than technology defined the lives of the children of that time.
  • Option 1 & 2 do not substantiate the given passage as it is contradicting the given information.
  • Option 4 may seem to be the right answer but it only concentrates on not having smartphones during that era.

Hence, the most logical and rational inference that can be made is that option 3.

quiz.text:
Select the word which cannot be formed using the letters of the given word.

ADMINISTRATION

उस शब्द का चयन कीजिए जो दिए गए शब्द के अक्षरों के प्रयोग से नहीं बनाया जा सकता है।

ADMINISTRATION
quiz.solution:
Option 1 → STATION can be formed from the given word.

Option 2 → MINISTER cannot be formed from the given word, since there is no E in the word.

Option 3 → RATION can be formed from the given word.

Option 4 → MIND can be formed from the given word.

Hence, “minister” cannot be formed using letters of the given word.



विकल्प 1 → STATION दिए गए शब्द से बनाया जा सकता है।

विकल्प 2 → MINISTER दिए गए शब्द से नहीं बनाया जा सकता है, चूँकि शब्द में E उपस्थित नहीं है। 

विकल्प 3 → RATION दिए गए शब्द से बनाया जा सकता है।

विकल्प 4 → MIND दिए गए शब्द से बनाया जा सकता है।

अतः “minister” दिए गए शब्द के अक्षरों के प्रयोग से नहीं बनाया जा सकता है।

quiz.text:
Jitendra is facing east. He goes straight for 55 metres, turns left and walks 40 metres, then turns right and goes 45 metres, then again turns right and covers a distance of 50 metres. In which direction is he going?
जितेंद्र पूर्व दिशा के सम्मुख है। वह सीधे 55 मीटर जाता है, बाएं मुड़ता है और 40 मीटर चलता है, फिर दाएं मुड़ता है और 45 मीटर चलता है, पुनः दाएं मुड़ता है और 50 मीटर की दूरी तय करता है। वह किस दिशा में जा रहा है?
quiz.solution:
Drawing the diagram according to the given information,

  1. Jitendra is facing east.

  2. He goes straight for 55 metres

  3. Then turns left and walks 40 metres

  4. Then turns right and goes 45 metres

  5. Then again turns right and covers a distance of 50 metres.

Hence, he is going in "South" direction.



दी गई जानकारी के अनुसार आरेख बनाने पर,

  1. जितेंद्र पूर्व दिशा के सम्मुख है। 
  2. वह सीधे 55 मीटर जाता है। 
  3. फिर बाएं मुड़ता है और 40 मीटर चलता है। 
  4. फिर दाएं मुड़ता है और 45 मीटर जाता है। 
  5. फिर पुनः दाएं मुड़ता है और 50 मीटर की दूरी तय करता है।

अतः, वह "दक्षिण" दिशा में जा रहा है।

options:

quiz.text:
‘A # B’ means ‘A is the husband of B’.

‘A @ B’ means ‘A is the daughter of B’.

‘A & B’ means ‘A is the sister of B’.

If P & Q @ D # K @ S # T, then which of the following statements is NOT correct?


‘A # B’ का अर्थ है कि 'A, B का पति है'।

‘A @ B’ का अर्थ है कि 'A, B की पुत्री है'।

‘A & B' का अर्थ है कि 'A, B की बहन है'।

यदि P & Q @ D # K @ S # T है, तो निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा कथन सत्य नहीं है?
options:
(A) D is the daughter-in-law of T.
(A) D, T की बहू है।

(B) P is the daughter of K.
(B) P, K की पुत्री है।

(C) S is the maternal grandfather of Q.
(C) S, Q का नाना है।

(D) T is the mother of K.
(D) T, K की माता है।
quiz.solution:
From the given information:

‘A # B’ means ‘A is the husband of B’.
‘A @ B’ means ‘A is the daughter of B’.
‘A & B’ means ‘A is the sister of B’.
We substitute the values in the given equation:
P is the sister of Q, Q is the daughter of D, D is the husband of K, K is the daughter of S, S is the husband of T.
Now we draw a tree using the symbols:
                   

Now we consider the given options:
Option 1) D is the daughter-in-law of T - False (D is the son- in-low of T)
Option 2) P is the daughter of K - True
Option 3) S is the maternal grandfather of Q - True
Option 4) T is the mother of K - True

Hence the correct answer is option 1)



दी गई जानकारी के अनुसार:

‘A # B’ का अर्थ है कि 'A, B का पति है'।

‘A @ B’ का अर्थ है कि 'A, B की पुत्री है'।

‘A & B' का अर्थ है कि 'A, B की बहन है'।

हम दिए गए समीकरण में मानों को प्रतिस्थापित करते हैं:
P, Q की बहन है, Q, D की पुत्री है, D, K का पति है, K, S की पुत्री है, S, T का पति है
अब हम प्रतीकों का उपयोग करके एक आरेख बनाते हैं:
                    

अब हम दिए गए विकल्पों पर विचार करते हैं:
विकल्प 1)  D, T की बहू है - असत्य (D, T का दामाद है)
विकल्प 2)  P, K की पुत्री है - सत्य
विकल्प 3)  S, Q का नाना है - सत्य
विकल्प 4 )  T, K की माता है - सत्य

अत: सही उत्तर विकल्प 1 है।

quiz.text:
If today is Monday, then what will be the day after 63 days?
यदि आज सोमवार है, तो 63 दिनों के बाद कौन-सा दिन होगा?
quiz.solution:
Each day of the week is repeated after 7 days.

Today is Monday.

After 63 days = 63 / 7 = 0 odd day

So, after 63 days will be the same day (because it is multiple of 7) i.e. Monday.

Hence, "option 1" is the correct answer.



सप्ताह का प्रत्येक दिन 7 दिनों के बाद दोहराया जाता है।

आज सोमवार है।

63 दिनों के बाद = 63/7 = 0 विषम दिन

इसलिए, 63 दिनों के बाद वही दिन होगा (क्योंकि यह 7 का गुणज है) अर्थात सोमवार।

अत:, "विकल्प 1" सही उत्तर है।

quiz.solution:
The given codes are:

The king lives in the palace → @ H U @ # !

Palace wise king → G H #

The logic follows here is:

Therefore, from the above codes, it is clear that the code for 'wise' is 'G' and the code for 'the' is '@'.

Hence, the correct answer is G @.



दिए गए कूट हैं:

Mango is the king of fruit → @ $ % & H E

The king lives in the palace → @ H U @ # !

Palace wise king → G H #

यहाँ अनुसरित तर्क इस प्रकार है:

अत:, सही उत्तर G @ है।

quiz.text:
Prameet purchased 6 Grapes, 3 apples and 10 guavas in ₹136. If the ratio of the cost (per piece) of grapes, apple and guavas is 3 : 2 : 1, what will be the total cost of 1 grapes, 2 apples and 3 guavas?
प्रमीत ने ₹136 में 6 अंगूर, 3 सेब और 10 अमरूद खरीदे। यदि अंगूर, सेब और अमरूद का क्रय मूल्यों (प्रति) का अनुपात 3 : 2 : 1 है, तब 1 अंगूर, 2 सेब और 3 अमरूद का कुल मूल्य कितना होगा?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Prameet purchased 6 grapes, 3 apples and 10 guavas in ₹136. If the ratio of the cost (per piece) of grapes, apples  and guavas is 3 : 2 : 1.

Let:

The cost (per piece) of grapes be 3x,

The cost (per piece) of apples be 2x,

The cost (per piece) of guavas be x,

Then, according to the question,

6 (3x) + 3 (2x) + 10 (x)  = 136

18x + 6x + 10x = 136

34x = 136

x = 4

Then, the cost (per piece) of grapes, apples , and guava is ₹12, ₹8, and ₹4 respectively.

Therefore, the cost of 1 grapes, 2 apples and 3 guavas = 12 × 1 + 8 × 2 + 4 × 3

= 12 + 16 + 12 

= ₹40

Hence, ₹40 is the correct answer.



दिया गया है:

प्रमीत ने ₹136 में 6 अंगूर, 3 सेब और 10 अमरूद खरीदे। यदि अंगूर, सेब और अमरूद का क्रय मूल्यों (प्रति) का अनुपात 3 : 2 : 1 है।

माना:

अंगूर का मूल्य (प्रति) 3x है,

सेब का मूल्य (प्रति) 2x है,

अमरूद का मूल्य (प्रति) x है,

फिर, प्रश्न के अनुसार,

6 (3x) + 3 (2x) + 10 (x)  = 136

18x + 6x + 10x = 136

34x = 136

x = 4

फिर, अंगूर, सेब और अमरूद का मूल्य (प्रति) क्रमशः ₹12, ₹8 और ₹4 है।

इस प्रकार, 1 अंगूर, 2 सेब और 3 अमरूद का मूल्य = 12 × 1 + 8 × 2 + 4 × 3

= 12 + 16 + 12 

= ₹40

अत:, ₹40 सही उत्तर है।

quiz.text:
In a class, a passed student’s rank is 19th from the right and 26th from the left. Find the total number of students if 7 students are failed in the class.
एक कक्षा में, एक उत्तीर्ण विद्यार्थी की दाएं से 19वीं और बाएं से 26वीं रैंक है। यदि, कक्षा में 7 छात्र अनुत्तीर्ण हो जाते हैं, तो कक्षा में कुल छात्रों की संख्या ज्ञात कीजिए।
quiz.solution:
Student’s rank from right = 19

Student’s rank from left = 26
Total passed students = Student’s rank from right + Student’s rank from left - 1

→ 19 + 26 - 1

→ 44

Passed students = 44

Failed students = 7

Thus, total students = 44 + 7

→ 51

Hence, the total number of students is 51.

दाएं से विद्यार्थी की रैंक = 19

बाएं से विद्यार्थी की रैंक = 26

कुल उत्तीर्ण विद्यार्थी = दाएं से विद्यार्थी की रैंक + बाएं से विद्यार्थी की रैंक - 1

→ 19 + 26 - 1

→ 44

उत्तीर्ण विद्यार्थी = 44

अनुत्तीर्ण विद्यार्थी = 7

इस प्रकार, कुल विद्यार्थियों की संख्या = 44 + 7

→ 51

अतः विद्यार्थियों की कुल संख्या 51 है।

quiz.text:
Six girls are sitting in a row facing North.

i. Navika is to the immediate left of Seema, whose neighbour is Sabnam.

ii. Hima is sitting at one end of the row, but not Sabnam.

iii. Rupali is between Vinita and Navika.

Who is sitting at the other end of the row?


छह लड़कियां एक पंक्ति में उत्तर की ओर मुख करके बैठी हैं।

i. नविका, सीमा, जिसकी पड़ोसन सबनम है, के ठीक बायें है।

ii. हिमा पंक्ति के एक छोर पर बैठी है, लेकिन सबनम नहीं।

iii. रूपाली, विनीता और नविका के बीच में है।

पंक्ति के दूसरे छोर पर कौन बैठी है?
quiz.solution:
Six girls Navika, Seema, Sabnam, Hima, Rupali and Vinita are sitting in a row facing North.

1) Hima is sitting at one end of the row, but not Sabnam.  Sabnam is not sitting at any end of the row. So, there have two cases.

 

2) Navika is to the immediate left of Seema, whose neighbour is Sabnam. Sabnam is not sitting at any end of the row. So, there have five possibilities.

3) Rupali is between Vinita and Navika. Then all cases are eliminated Except case (5).

Hence, Vinita  is sitting at the other end of the row.



छह लड़कियां नविका, सीमा, सबनम, हिमा, रूपाली और विनीता एक पंक्ति में उत्तर की ओर मुख करके बैठी हैं।

1) हिमा पंक्ति के एक छोर पर बैठी है, लेकिन सबनम नहीं। सबनम पंक्ति के किसी भी छोर पर नहीं बैठी है। इसलिए, दो स्थितियां हैं।

 

2) नविका, सीमा, जिसकी पड़ोसन सबनम है, के ठीक बायें है। सबनम पंक्ति के किसी भी छोर पर नहीं बैठी है। इसलिए, वहाँ पाँच संभावनाएँ हैं।

3) रूपाली विनीता और नविका के बीच में है। फिर स्थिति (5) को छोड़कर सभी स्थितियों को समाप्त कर दिया जाता है।

अत:, विनीता पंक्ति के दूसरे छोर पर बैठी है।

quiz.text:
If the ratio between the curved surface area and the total surface area of a right circular cylinder is 15 : 22, find the ratio of the height to the diameter of the cylinder.
यदि एक लम्ब वृत्तीय बेलन के वक्र पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल और कुल पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल के बीच का अनुपात 15 : 22 है, तो बेलन की ऊँचाई का व्यास से अनुपात ज्ञात कीजिए।
quiz.solution:
Given:

The ratio between the curved surface area and the total surface area of a right circular cylinder is 15 : 22

Formula used:

let r and h be radius and height

Curved Surface area of cylinder = 2πrh

Total Surface area of cylinder = 2πr (h+r)

Calculation:

\(\frac{2πrh}{2πr(r+h)}\) = \(\frac{15}{22}\)

\(\frac{h}{r+h}\) = \(\frac{15}{22}\)

\(\frac{r +h}{h} =\frac{22}{15}\)

\(\frac{r}{h} +1 =\frac{22}{15}\)

\(\frac{r}{h} =\frac{7}{15}\)

\(\frac{2r}{2h} = \frac{7}{15}\)

\(\frac{d}{h} = \frac{14}{15}\)

Ratio of the height to the diameter of the cylinder = Height : Diameter

= 15 : 14

Answer is 15 : 14.



दिया गया है:

एक लम्ब वृत्तीय बेलन के वक्र पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल और कुल पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल का अनुपात 15 : 22 है

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

माना r और h त्रिज्या और ऊँचाई हैं

बेलन का वक्र पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल = 2πrh

बेलन का कुल पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल = 2πr (h+r)

गणना:

\(\frac{2πrh}{2πr(r+h)}\) = \(\frac{15}{22}\)

\(\frac{h}{r+h}\) = \(\frac{15}{22}\)

\(\frac{r +h}{h} =\frac{22}{15}\)

\(\frac{r}{h} +1 =\frac{22}{15}\)

\(\frac{r}{h} =\frac{7}{15}\)

\(\frac{2r}{2h} = \frac{7}{15}\)

\(\frac{d}{h} = \frac{14}{15}\)

बेलन के व्यास का ऊँचाई से अनुपात = ऊँचाई : व्यास

= 15 : 14

उत्तर 15 : 14 है।

quiz.text:
A Sçooty is available for ₹ 50,000 cash or ₹10,400 cash down payments followed by 4 equal annual installments. If the rate of simple interest is 25% per annum, amount of each year installment is-
एक स्कूटी 50,000 रुपये नगद अथवा 10,400 रुपये नगद अग्रिम भुगतान पर चार बराबर वार्षिक किस्तों के साथ उपलब्ध है। यदि साधारण ब्याज की दर 25% वार्षिक है, तो प्रत्येक वार्षिक किस्त की राशि कितनी है?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Scooty price = Rs. 50,000

Down payment = Rs. 10,400

Number of installments = 4

Rate of interest = 25% 

Concept used : 

A = P + SI 

Where,

\(SI = \frac{{P}×{R}×{T}}{100}\)

Calculation:

Since Rs.10,400 was given for down payments.

∴ Amount to be paid  = Rs. 39600

According to the question,

⇒ 39600 + 39600 × 25/100 × 4 =

\([x + (x + \frac{25x}{100}) + (x + \frac{{25}×{2x}}{100}) + (x +\frac{{25}×{3x}}{100}) ]\)

⇒ 39600 + 39600 × 25/100 × 4 = \([x + \frac{5x}{4} + \frac{3x}{2} + \frac{7x}{4}]\)

⇒ \(79200 =\) \(\frac{22x}{4}\)

⇒ \(7200 = \frac{2x}{4}\)

⇒ x = 14400

∴ The correct answer is Rs.14400.



दिया गया है:

स्कूटी का मूल्य = 50,000 रुपये

अग्रिम भुगतान = 10,400 रुपये

किस्तों की संख्या = 4

ब्याज दर = 25%

प्रयुक्त अवधारणा:

मिश्रधन (A) = मूलधन (P) + साधारण ब्याज (SI) 

जहाँ

\(SI = \frac{{P}×{R}×{T}}{100}\)

गणना:

चूँकि अग्रिम भुगतान के लिए 10,400 रुपये दिए गए थे।

∴ भुगतान के लिए शेष राशि = 39600 रुपये 

प्रश्नानुसार,

⇒ 39600 + 39600 × 25/100 × 4 =

\([x + (x + \frac{25x}{100}) + (x + \frac{{25}×{2x}}{100}) + (x +\frac{{25}×{3x}}{100}) ]\)

⇒ 39600 + 39600 × 25/100 × 4 = \([x + \frac{5x}{4} + \frac{3x}{2} + \frac{7x}{4}]\)

⇒ \(79200 =\) \(\frac{22x}{4}\)

⇒ \(7200 = \frac{2x}{4}\)

⇒ x = 14400

∴ सही उत्तर 14400 रुपये है।

quiz.text:
sum is invested at compound interest payable annually. The interest in two successive years are Rs.1,025 and Rs.1,107, respectively. The rate of interest per annum is:

वार्षिक रूप से संयोजित चक्रवृद्धि ब्याज पर राशि निवेश की जाती है। दो क्रमागत वर्षों में ब्याज क्रमशः 1,025 रुपये और 1,107 रुपये है। प्रति वर्ष ब्याज दर है:
quiz.solution:
Given:

The interest in two successive years are Rs.1,025 and Rs.1,107

Formula used:

SI = \(\dfrac{principle × rate × time}{{100}}\)

Calculations:

Interest of first year = Rs. 1025 and interest of second year = Rs. 1107

So, the required difference between the interests = 1107 - 1025 = Rs. 82

Here, Rs. 82 is the interest on Rs. 1025 for 1 year.

Now, rate = \(\dfrac{82 × 100}{{1025 × 1}}\)

rate = \(\dfrac{8200}{{1025}}\)

rate = 8%

∴ The answer is 8%.



दिया गया है:

दो क्रमागत वर्षों में ब्याज क्रमशः 1,025 रुपये और 1,107 रुपये है।

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

SI = \(\dfrac{principle × rate × time}{{100}}\)

गणना:

पहले वर्ष का ब्याज = 1025 रुपये और दूसरे वर्ष का ब्याज = 1107 रुपये

इसलिए, ब्याज के बीच आवश्यक अंतर = 1107 - 1025 = 82 रुपये 

यहाँ, 1025 रुपये पर 1 वर्ष के लिए 82 रुपये का ब्याज है।

अब, ब्याज दर = \(\dfrac{82 × 100}{{1025 × 1}}\)

ब्याज दर = \(\dfrac{8200}{{1025}}\)

ब्याज दर = 8%

∴ उत्तर 8% है।

quiz.text:
The value of \(\frac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\) is:
\(\frac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\) का मान क्या है?
quiz.solution:
Given:

\(\dfrac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\)

Calculations:

\(\dfrac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\)

= \(\dfrac{3\times (3)^{3(n+1)}\,+\,3^2\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 3^{(3n)}}\)

= \(\dfrac{3\times (3)^{(3n+3)}\,+\,(3)^{2+3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 3^{(3n)}}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+3+1)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n)} × (8 - 5)}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+4)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n)} × 3}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+4)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n+1)}}\)

now, equating each of the part individually,

33n+4 + 3n+1

= (33n × 34) + (3n × 31)

And, equating the denominator part, 33n+1

= 33n × 31

Now, if we divide the two parts and take 3n and 3 as common we are going to left with 33 + 1

= 33 + 1

= 27 + 1

= 28

∴ The answer is 28.



दिया गया है:

\(\dfrac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\)

गणना:

\(\dfrac{3\times (27)^{(n+1)}\,+\,9\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 27^n}\)

= \(\dfrac{3\times (3)^{3(n+1)}\,+\,3^2\times (3)^{3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 3^{(3n)}}\)

= \(\dfrac{3\times (3)^{(3n+3)}\,+\,(3)^{2+3n-1}}{8\times 3^{(3n)}-5\times 3^{(3n)}}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+3+1)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n)} × (8 - 5)}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+4)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n)} × 3}\)

= \(\dfrac{(3)^{(3n+4)}\,+\,(3)^{3n+1}}{3^{(3n+1)}}\)

अब, प्रत्येक भाग को अलग-अलग हल करने पर,

33n+4 + 3n+1

= (33n × 34) + (3n × 31)

और हर 33n+1 को हल करने पर,

= 33n × 31

अब, यदि हम दो भागों को विभाजित करते हैं और 3n और 3 को उभयनिष्ठ मान लेते हैं, तो हम 33 + 1 के साथ बाईं ओर जाते हैं

= 33 + 1

= 27 + 1

= 28

∴ उत्तर 28 है।

quiz.text:
The line chart given below shows the number of glasses sold by a shop in 5 consecutive months.

What is the average number of glasses sold by the shop per month?


नीचे दिया गया रेखा आलेख एक दुकान द्वारा 5 क्रमिक महीनों में बेचे गए ग्लास की संख्या को दर्शाता है।

दुकान द्वारा प्रति माह बेचे गए ग्लास की औसत संख्या क्या है?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Line chart which shows the number of glasses sold by a shop in 5 consecutive months.

Formula used:

Average = Sum of quantities / Number of quantities

Calculation:

Average number of glasses sold by the shop per month,

Average = total number of glasses / number of months

\(Average = \dfrac{1250 + 1365 + 1785 + 1140 + 1670}{5}\)

Average = 7210 / 5

Average = 1442.

∴ 1442 is the average number of glasses sold by the shop per month.



दिया गया है:

रेखा आलेख एक दुकान द्वारा 5 क्रमिक महीनों में बेचे गए ग्लास की संख्या को दर्शाता है।

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

औसत = मात्राओं का योग / मात्राओं की संख्या

गणना:

दुकान द्वारा प्रतिमाह बेचे गए ग्लास की औसत संख्या

औसत = ग्लास की कुल संख्या / महीनों की संख्या

\(Average = \dfrac{1250 + 1365 + 1785 + 1140 + 1670}{5}\)

औसत = 7210 / 5

औसत = 1442.

∴ दुकान द्वारा प्रतिमाह बेचे गए ग्लास की औसत संख्या 1442 है।

quiz.text:
A solid right-circular cone is 11.2 cm high and the radius of its base is 2.8 cm. If the cone is melted and recast into a sphere, then what will be the diameter of the sphere?
एक ठोस लम्ब वृत्तीय शंकु 11.2 सेमी ऊँचा है और इसके आधार की त्रिज्या 2.8 सेमी है। यदि शंकु को पिघलाकर एक गोले में ढाला जाता है, तो गोले का व्यास कितना होगा?
quiz.solution:
Given: 

Height of right circular cone = 11.2 cm 

Radius of its base = 2.8 cm.

Concept : 

volume of sphere = (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3

Volume of the cone = (\(\frac{1}{3}\)) x πr'2h

Solution :

Let radius of sphere be r.

Now, the volume of sphere = (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3

For cone, h = 11.2 cm, r' = 2.8 cm
 
Now , the Volume of the cone = the volume of the sphere
 
⇒ (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3 = (\(\frac{1}{3}\))πr'2h
 
⇒ 4r3 = r'2h
 
⇒ 4r3 = [(2.8)2 × (11.2)]
 
⇒ r3 = [(2.8)2 × (11.2)/4]
 
⇒ r3 = [(2.8)2 × 2.8]
 
⇒ r3 = (2.8)3
 
⇒ r = 2.8
 
The diameter is 2r = 2 × (2.8) = 5.6 cm
 
∴ The diameter is 2r = 2 × (2.8) = 5.6 cm
 


दिया गया:

लम्ब वृत्तीय शंकु की ऊँचाई = 11.2 सेमी

इसके आधार की त्रिज्या = 2.8 सेमी.

अवधारणा:

गोले का आयतन 

= (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3

शंकु का आयतन= (\(\frac{1}{3}\)) x πr'2h

हल :

माना गोले की त्रिज्या r है।

अब गोले का आयतन = (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3

शंकु के लिए, h = 11.2 cm, r' = 2.8 cm
 
अब, शंकु का आयतन = गोले का आयतन
 
⇒ (\(\frac{4}{3}\))πr3 = (\(\frac{1}{3}\))πr'2h
 
⇒ 4r3 = r'2h
 
⇒ 4r3 = [(2.8)2 × (11.2)]
 
⇒ r3 = [(2.8)2 × (11.2)/4]
 
⇒ r3 = [(2.8)2 × 2.8]
 
⇒ r3 = (2.8)3
 
⇒ r = 2.8
 
व्यास  2r = 2 × (2.8) = 5.6 cm है
 
∴व्यास  2r = 2 × (2.8) = 5.6 cm है

quiz.text:
The average of 15 numbers is 180. The average of first 8 numbers is 110 and that of the last 8 number is 250. If the 7th number is 160. and if the 7th and 8th number are excluded, then what is the average of the remaining number(correct to one decimal place).

15 संख्याओं का औसत 180 है। पहली 8 संख्याओं का औसत 110 है और अंतिम 8 संख्याओं का औसत 250 है। यदि 7वीं संख्या 160 है और यदि 7वीं और 8वीं संख्या को हटा दिया जाए, तो शेष संख्याओं का औसत कितना है? (एक दशमलव स्थान तक सही)
quiz.solution:
Given:

Average of 15 numbers = 180

Average of First 8 numbers = 110

Average of last 8 numbers = 250

7th Number = 160

Concept:

Average = Sum of all observations / Number of observations

Calculation:

According to the question

Sum of 15 numbers = 180 × 15

⇒ 2700

Sum of first 8 numbers = 110 × 8

⇒ 880

Sum of last 8 numbers = 250 × 8

⇒ 2000

So, The value of 8th number = sum of first 8 numbers + sum of last 8th numbers - sum of 15 numbers

⇒ 880 + 2000 - 2700

⇒ 2880 - 2700

⇒ 180

Sum of 13 numbers when 7th and 8th number excluded = 2700 - 160 - 180

⇒ 2700 - 340

⇒ 2360

Average of remaining numbers = 2360/13

⇒ 181.5

∴ The average of 13 numbers is 181.5.

Shortcut TrickSum of 15 numbers = 180 × 15 = 2700Sum of first 8 numbers = 110 × 8 = 880 Sum of last 8 numbers = 250 × 8 = 2000

So, The value of 8th number = 880 + 2000 - 2700

⇒ 180

Sum of 13 numbers when 7th and 8th number excluded =

⇒  2700 - 160 - 180 = 2360

Average of remaining numbers = 2360 / 13 = 181.5

 



दिया गया है:

15 संख्याओं का औसत = 180

पहली 8 संख्याओं का औसत = 110

अंतिम 8 संख्याओं का औसत = 250

7वीं संख्या = 160

अवधारणा:

औसत = सभी प्रेक्षणों का योग / प्रेक्षणों की संख्या

गणना:

प्रश्नानुसार,

15 संख्याओं का योग = 180 × 15

⇒ 2700

पहली 8 संख्याओं का योग = 110 × 8

⇒ 880

अंतिम 8 संख्याओं का योग = 250 × 8

⇒ 2000

इसलिए, 8वीं संख्या का मान = पहली 8 संख्याओं का योग +  अंतिम 8 संख्याओं का योग - 15 संख्याओं का योग

⇒ 880 + 2000 - 2700

⇒ 2880 - 2700

⇒ 180

13 संख्याओं का योग जब 7वीं और 8वीं संख्या को समाप्त कर दिया जाता है = 2700 - 160 - 180

⇒ 2700 - 340

⇒ 2360

शेष संख्याओं का औसत = 2360/13

⇒ 181.5

∴ शेष 13 संख्याओं का औसत 181.5 है। 

Shortcut Trick15 संख्याओं का योग = 180 × 15 = 2700
पहली 8 संख्याओं का योग = 110 × 8 = 880 

अंतिम 8 संख्याओं का योग = 250 × 8 = 2000

इसलिए, 8वीं संख्या का मान = 880 + 2000 - 2700

⇒ 180

13 संख्याओं का योग जब 7वीं और 8वीं संख्या को हटा दिया जाता है =

⇒  2700 - 160 - 180 = 2360

शेष संख्याओं का औसत​ = 2360 / 13 = 181.5

quiz.text:
Simplify the following expression:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} \div \frac{{15}}{2} \times \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} \div \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} \times \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} \div \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)


निम्नलिखित व्यंजक को सरल कीजिए:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} \div \frac{{15}}{2} \times \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} \div \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} \times \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} \div \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)
quiz.solution:
Given:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} ÷ \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)

Concept:

Follow the BODMAS rule according to the table given below:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} ÷ \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)

⇒ \({{{17\over2}×{2\over15}×{13\over2}}}\over{{17\over2}×{4\over13×15}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\)

⇒​ \({{17×13}\over{15×2}}\over{{17×2}\over{13×15}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\)

⇒​ \({{17×13}\over{15×2}}\) × \({{13×15}\over{17×2}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\) 

⇒​ \(169\over4\) × \(30\over169\) = \(15\over2\) = \({7}{1\over2}\)



 दिया है:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} ÷ \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)

प्रयुक्त अवधारणा:

नीचे दी गई तालिका के अनुसार BODMAS नियम का पालन करें:

गणना:

\(\frac{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}}}{{\frac{{17}}{2} ÷ \left( {\frac{{15}}{2} × \frac{{13}}{2}} \right)}} ÷ \frac{{169}}{{30}}\)

⇒ \({{{17\over2}×{2\over15}×{13\over2}}}\over{{17\over2}×{4\over13×15}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\)

⇒ \({{17×13}\over{15×2}}\over{{17×2}\over{13×15}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\)

⇒ \({{17×13}\over{15×2}}\) × \({{13×15}\over{17×2}}\) ÷ \(169\over30\)

⇒ \(169\over4\) × \(30\over169\) = \(15\over2\) = \({7}{1\over2}\)

quiz.text:
A dealer buys a table marked at a price of Rs. 2000. He gets two successive discounts as 10 % and 25% on the price marked. He spends Rs. 30 on the transportation and sells the table at a profit of 15%. Find the selling price of the table ?
एक व्यापारी 2000 रुपये अंकित मूल्य की एक मेज खरीदता है। उसे अंकित मूल्य पर 10% और 25% के रूप में दो क्रमागत छूट मिलती है। वह परिवहन पर 30 रुपये खर्च करता है और मेज को 15% के लाभ पर बेचता है। मेज का विक्रय मूल्य ज्ञात कीजिए?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Marked price of the table = Rs. 2000

Discounts = 10% and 25%

Transportation cost = Rs. 30 

Profit after selling the table = 15%

Formula Used:

Marked price after discount (M.P.) = Original M.P. (1 - d1/100 ) (1 - d2/100)

S.P. = C.P (1 + P/100) where, S.P = Selling price, C.P = Cost Price, P=Profit

Calculation:

Firstly, Calculating the marked price after the discounts:

M.P. = 2000 (1 - 10/100 ) (1 -  25/100)

⇒  M.P. = 2000 × .9 × .75 = 1350 Rs.

Now after adding the transportation cost the total cost price will be : 1350 + 30 = 1380 Rs.

Calculating now the selling price:

S.P. = 1380 (1 + 15/100)

= 1380 × 23/20 = 1587 Rs.

∴ The selling price will be 1587 Rs.



दिया गया है:

मेज का अंकित मूल्य = 2000 रुपये

छूट = 10% और 25%

परिवहन लागत = 30 रुपये

मेज बेचने के बाद लाभ = 15%

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

छूट के बाद अंकित मूल्य (M.P.) = वास्तविक अंकित मूल्य ( 1 - d1/100 ) ( 1 - d2/100)

S.P. = C.P. ( 1 + P/ 100 ) जहाँ, S.P. = विक्रय मूल्य, C.P. = क्रय मूल्य, P = लाभ

गणना:

सबसे पहले, छूट के बाद अंकित मूल्यों की गणना करने पर:

अंकित मूल्य = 2000 ( 1 - 10/100 ) ( 1 -  25/100)

⇒  अंकित मूल्य = 2000 × .9 × .75 = 1350 रुपये

अब परिवहन लागत को जोड़ने के बाद कुल क्रय मूल्य होगा: 1350 + 30 = 1380 रुपये

अब, विक्रय मूल्य की गणना करने पर:

विक्रय मूल्य = 1380 ( 1 + 15/100)

= 1380 × 23/20 = 1587 रुपये

∴  विक्रय मूल्य 1587 रुपये होगा।

quiz.text:
4800 people are employed in a company out of which 45% are males. 60% of the males are either 25 year or more in age. How many males are there in the company less than 25 years of age?
एक कंपनी में 4800 लोग कार्यरत हैं, जिनमे से 45 प्रतिशत पुरुष हैं और उन पुरुषो में 60 प्रतिशत पुरुषों की आयु या तो 25 वर्ष है या उससे अधिक है। तो कंपनी में 25 वर्ष से कम आयु के कार्यरत पुरुष कितने हैं?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Total number of people employed in a company = 4800

Number of males = 45%

Number of males who are either 25 years or more in age = 60%

Calculation:

According to the question

Number of males = ( 4800 × \(\frac{45}{{100}}\)) = 2160

Number of males who are either 25 years or more in age

⇒ (2160 × \(\frac{60}{{100}}\)) = 1296

Now, the number of males are there in the company less than 25

years of age = (2160 - 1296) = 864

∴ The number of males less than 25 years is 864

Shortcut TrickMales less than 25 years = 4800 × (45/100) × (40/100)

= 864

Note - males are 45% and 60% of the males are either 25 years or more in age. But we have to find the number of males less than 25 years so use 40%.



दिया गया है:

एक कंपनी में कार्यरत लोगों की कुल संख्या = 4800

पुरुषों की संख्या = 45%

उन पुरुषों की संख्या, जिनकी आयु 25 वर्ष या उससे अधिक है = 60%

गणना:

प्रश्नानुसार,

पुरुषों की संख्या = ( 4800 × \(\frac{45}{{100}}\)) = 2160

उन पुरुषों की संख्या, जिनकी आयु 25 वर्ष या उससे अधिक है

⇒ (2160 × \(\frac{60}{{100}}\)) = 1296

अब, कंपनी में 25 वर्ष से कम आयु के पुरुषों की संख्या = (2160 - 1296) = 864

∴ 25 वर्ष से कम आयु के पुरुषों की संख्या 864 है।

Shortcut Trick 25 वर्ष से कम पुरुष = 4800 × (45/100) × (40/100)

= 864

नोट - पुरुष 45% हैं और 60% पुरुष या तो 25 वर्ष या उससे अधिक आयु के हैं। लेकिन हमें 25 वर्ष से कम उम्र के पुरुषों की संख्या का पता लगाना है इसलिए 40% का इस्तेमाल करें।

quiz.text:
My father distributed Rs. 280 in such a way that each girl receive Rs. 20 and each boy Rs. 10. If the number of boys is less than that of girls by 2, find the number of boys.

मेरे पिता ने 280 रुपये इस प्रकार बांटे कि प्रत्येक लड़की को 20 रुपये और प्रत्येक लड़के को 10 रुपये मिले। यदि लड़कों की संख्या, लड़कियों की संख्या से 2 कम है, तो लड़कों की संख्या ज्ञात कीजिए।
quiz.solution:
Given:- Total money = Rs. 280.

Each girl received = Rs. 20.

Each boy received Rs. 10

Number of boys = number of girls - 2

Calculation:-

Let the number of boys be b and the number of girls be g,

According to the question,

⇒ 20 × g + 10 × b = 280

⇒ 2g + b = 28 ------------ (i)

It is given in the question that,

number of boys = number of girls - 2

⇒ b = g - 2

⇒ g = b + 2 ---------- (ii)

Substituting the value of 'g' in eq (i),

⇒ 2(b + 2) + b = 28

⇒ 2b + 4 + b = 28

⇒ 3b = 24

⇒ b = 8

.·. The number of boys is 8.



दिया है:- कुल राशि = 280 रुपये 

प्रत्येक लड़की को 20 रुपये प्राप्त होता है।

प्रत्येक लड़के को 10 रुपये प्राप्त होता है।

लड़कों की संख्या = लड़कियों की संख्या - 2

गणना:-

माना लड़कों की संख्या b और लड़कियों की संख्या g है,

प्रश्नानुसार,

⇒ 20 × g + 10 × b = 280

⇒ 2g + b = 28 ------------ (i)

प्रश्न में दिया गया है कि,

लड़कों की संख्या = लड़कियों की संख्या - 2

⇒ b = g - 2

⇒ g = b + 2 ---------- (ii)

समीकरण (i) में 'g' का मान रखने पर,

⇒ 2(b + 2) + b = 28

⇒ 2b + 4 + b = 28

⇒ 3b = 24

⇒ b = 8

.·. लड़कों की संख्या 8 है।

quiz.text:
Ketan and Kunal can complete a job together in 7 days. Kunal is \(\frac{7}{4}\) times as efficient as Ketan. In how many days can Kunal alone complete the job?
केतन और कुणाल मिलकर एक कार्य को 7 दिनों में पूरा कर सकते हैं। कुणाल, केतन से \(\frac{7}{4}\) गुना अधिक कुशल है। कुणाल अकेले कार्य को कितने दिनों में पूरा कर सकता है?
quiz.solution:
Given:

Ketan and Kunal complete job together = 7 days

Kunal = 7/4 times as efficient as Ketan

Formula Used:

Efficiency = Total work/No. of days 

Calculations:

Kunal = 7/4 times as efficient as ketan

⇒ Efficiency of Kunal: Efficiency of ketan = 7:4

⇒ Total Efficiency = ( 7 +4) = `11

⇒  Total work = Efficiency × No. of days  = 11× 7 = 77

Now, Kunal's efficiency = 7 

⇒ No. of days kunal takes to complete  the work alone =  Total work / Efficiency = 77/7 = 11 days

Hence, Kunal alone takes 11 days to complete the work.



दिया गया है:

केतन और कुणाल एक साथ कार्य पूरा करते हैं = 7 दिन

कुणाल = केतन से 7/4 गुना अधिक कुशल

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

क्षमता = कुल कार्य/दिनों की संख्या

गणना:

कुणाल = केतन से 7/4 गुना कुशल

⇒ कुणाल की क्षमता : केतन की क्षमता = 7:4

⇒ कुल क्षमता = (7 +4) = `11

⇒ कुल कार्य = क्षमता × दिनों की संख्या = 11× 7 = 77

अब, कुणाल की क्षमता = 7

⇒ कुणाल को अकेले कार्य पूरा करने में लगने वाले दिनों की संख्या = कुल कार्य/ क्षमता = 77/7 = 11 दिन

अतः, अकेले कुणाल को कार्य पूरा करने में 11 दिन लगते हैं।

quiz.text:
Kunal sold a washing machine to Prem at a profit of 40%. Prem sold it to Ravi at a loss of 25%. If kunal Paid Rs. 48,000 for the washing machine then find the cost price of Ravi.
कुणाल ने एक वाशिंग मशीन को प्रेम को 40% के लाभ पर बेचा। प्रेम ने इसे रवि को 25% हानि पर बेच दिया। यदि कुणाल ने वाशिंग मशीन के लिए 48,000 रुपये भुगतान किए, तो रवि का क्रय मूल्य ज्ञात कीजिए।
quiz.solution:
Given:

Kunal sold to Prem at profit = 40%

Prem sold it to Ravi at loss = 25%

Cost price for Kunal = Rs. 48000

Concept used:

Profit% = [(S.P. - C.P.) / C.P.] × 100

Loss% = [(C.P. – S.P.) / C.P.] × 100

where

S.P. = Selling price

C.P. = Cost price

Calculation:

Kunal sold to Prem at profit of 40%

Profit% = [(S.P. - C.P.) / C.P.] × 100

\(40 = \dfrac{SP - 48000}{48000} \times 100\)

\(40 = \dfrac{SP - 48000}{480} \)

40 × 480 = SP - 48000

SP = 48000 + 19200

SP = 67200.

Prem sold it to Ravi at a loss of 25%

Loss% = [(C.P. – S.P.) / C.P.] × 100

\(25 = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200} \times 100\)

\(\dfrac{25}{100} = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200}\)

\(\dfrac{1}{4} = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200}\)

(67200 / 4) = 67200 - SP

16800 = 67200 - SP

SP = 67200 - 16800

SP = Rs. 50400.

This is the CP for Ravi.

∴ The cost price of Ravi is Rs. 50400.



दिया गया है:

कुणाल ने लाभ पर प्रेम को बेचा = 40%

प्रेम ने उसे हानि पर रवि को बेच दिया = 25%

कुणाल का क्रय मूल्य = 48000 रुपये

प्रयुक्त अवधारणा:

लाभ% = [(S.P. - C.P.) / C.P.] × 100

हानि% = [(C.P. – S.P.) / C.P.] × 100

जहाँ

S.P. = विक्रय मूल्य

C.P. = क्रय मूल्य

गणना:

कुणाल ने एक वाशिंग मशीन को प्रेम को 40% के लाभ पर बेचा

लाभ% = [(विक्रय मूल्य - क्रय मूल्य) / क्रय मूल्य] × 100

\(40 = \dfrac{SP - 48000}{48000} \times 100\)

\(40 = \dfrac{SP - 48000}{480} \)

40 × 480 = SP - 48000

SP = 48000 + 19200

SP = 67200

प्रेम ने इसे रवि को 25% हानि पर बेचा

हानि% = [(क्रय मूल्य – विक्रय मूल्य) / क्रय मूल्य] × 100

\(25 = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200} \times 100\)

\(\dfrac{25}{100} = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200}\)

\(\dfrac{1}{4} = \dfrac{67200 - SP}{67200}\)

(67200 / 4) = 67200 - SP

16800 = 67200 - SP

SP = 67200 - 16800

SP = 50400 रुपये

यह रवि के लिए क्रय मूल्य है।

∴ रवि का क्रय मूल्य 50400 रुपये है।

quiz.text:
A thief seeing a policeman from a distance of 200 metres starts running at a speed of 8 km/h. The policeman gives chase immediately with a speed of 9 km/h and the thief is caught. What is the distance run by the thief?
एक चोर एक पुलिसकर्मी को 200 मीटर की दूरी से देखकर 8 किमी/घंटा की गति से दौड़ने लगता है। पुलिसकर्मी 9 किमी/घंटा की गति से तुरंत पीछा करता है और चोर पकड़ा जाता है। चोर द्वारा तय की गई दूरी कितनी है?
quiz.solution:
Given:

A thief seeing a policeman from a distance of 200 metres starts running at a speed of 8 km/h.

The policeman gives chase immediately with a speed of 9 km/h and the thief is caught.

Formula used:

Speed(s) = distance(d) / time(t)

Conversion of units = a km/h = 1 × \(\dfrac{{5a}}{{18}}\) = \(\dfrac{{5a}}{{18}}\) m/s.

Calculations:

Let us assume that the time taken by the policeman to catch the thief be t hours.

Hence, after time t, the thief will be at a distance of (t × 8 km/h) = (t × \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) ) m from where he started. (as, 8 × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{18}}\) = \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\)m/s)

At the same time, he will be at a distance, if (t × \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) + 200) m from where the policeman started.

Now, distance run by the policeman in time t = (t × 9 km/h) = (t × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{2}}\)) m. (as, 9 × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{18}}\) = \(\dfrac{{5}}{{2}}\) m/s)

According to the question,

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{2}}\) =\(\dfrac{{20t}}{{9}}\)+ 200

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{2}}\) - \(\dfrac{{20t}}{{9}}\)= 200

Taking the L.C.M. of the denominators.

\(\dfrac{{45t - 40t}}{{18}}\) = 200

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{18}}\)= 200

t = \(\dfrac{{200 × 18}}{{5}}\)

t = 720 secs.

∴ Distance covered by the thief = \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) × 720 = 1600 m = \(\dfrac{{1600}}{{1000}}\) = 1.6 km.

∴ The answer is 1.6 km.



दिया गया है:

एक चोर एक पुलिसकर्मी को 200 मीटर की दूरी से देखकर 8 किमी/घंटा की गति से दौड़ने लगता है।

पुलिसकर्मी 9 किमी/घंटा की गति से तुरंत पीछा करता है और चोर पकड़ा जाता है।

प्रयुक्त सूत्र:

गति(s) = दूरी(d) / समय(t)

इकाइयों का परिवर्तन = a किमी/घंटा = 1 × \(\dfrac{{5a}}{{18}}\) = \(\dfrac{{5a}}{{18}}\) मीटर/सेकंड

गणना:

मान लीजिए कि पुलिसकर्मी को चोर को पकड़ने में t घंटे का समय लगता है।

अत:, समय t के बाद चोर (t × 8 किमी/घंटा) की दूरी पर होगा =(t × \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\)) मीटर, जहाँ से उसने शुरू किया था। (चूँकि, 8 × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{18}}\) = \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) मीटर/सेकंड)
 
 

उसी समय, वह (t × \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) + 200) मीटर की दूरी पर होगा जहाँ से पुलिसकर्मी ने शुरू किया था।

अब, t समय में पुलिसकर्मी द्वारा तय की गई दूरी = (t × 9 किमी/घंटा) = (t × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{2}}\) ) मीटर (चूँकि, 9 × \(\dfrac{{5}}{{18}}\)= \(\dfrac{{5}}{{2}}\) मीटर/सेकंड)

प्रश्नानुसार,

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{2}}\) =\(\dfrac{{20t}}{{9}}\)+ 200

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{2}}\) - \(\dfrac{{20t}}{{9}}\)= 200

हरों का लघुत्तम समापवर्त्य लेने पर

\(\dfrac{{45t - 40t}}{{18}}\) = 200

\(\dfrac{{5t}}{{18}}\)= 200

t = \(\dfrac{{200 × 18}}{{5}}\)

t = 720 सेकंड

∴ चोर द्वारा तय की गई दूरी = \(\dfrac{{20}}{{9}}\) × 720 = 1600 मीटर = \(\dfrac{{1600}}{{1000}}\) = 1.6 किलोमीटर

∴ उत्तर 1.6 किमी है।

quiz.text:
The following Pi chart represents the number of people in a village who speak different languages.

If the total number of Boro people is 1080. Then what is the total number of Sindhi people?


 

निम्नलिखित वृत्त आलेख एक गाँव में विभिन्न भाषाएँ बोलने वाले लोगों की संख्या को दर्शाता है।

यदि बोरो लोगों की कुल संख्या 1080 है। तो सिंधी लोगों की कुल संख्या कितनी है?
quiz.solution:
Calculation:

The Boro people are 20 % that is 1080

The Sindhi people are 18 % 

So the value of 20 % is 1080

so value of 18 % = (1080 / 20) × 18

⇒ 54 × 18 = 972

The total number of Sindhi people is 972



गणना:

बोरो लोग 20% अर्थात 1080 हैं।

सिंधी लोग 18% हैं।

इसलिए, 20% का मान 1080 है।

इसलिए 18% का मान = (1080/20) × 18

⇒ 54 × 18 = 972

सिंधी लोगों की कुल संख्या 972 है।

quiz.text:
The national income is-
राष्ट्रीय आय निम्न होती है-
options:
(A) Net national product at market price
(A) बाजार मूल्य पर नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद

(B) Net domestic product at market price
(B) बाजार मूल्य पर नेट घरेलू उत्पाद

(C) Net domestic product at factor cost
(C) कारक लागत पर नेट घरेलू उत्पाद

(D) Net national product at factor cost
(D) कारक लागत पर नेट  राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is a net national product at factor cost.

Key Points

  • NNP at Factor Cost (Net National Product at Factor Cost) is the net money value of all goods and services produced by a country's normal people.
  • NNP at FC includes money earned by Indian citizens living in or outside of India.
  • NNP of Factor Cost = NDP at Factor Cost + Net Foreign Factor Income.
  • The Net National Product (NNP) of an economy is the GNP less the 'depreciation' loss. The formula for calculating it is as follows: NNP = GDP minus depreciation

Additional Information 

  • Gross national income (GNI), is the sum of a country’s gross domestic product (GDP) plus net income (positive or negative) from abroad.
  • For example, in a country in which many foreign businesses operate, GNI is much smaller than GDP, because the foreign businesses’ profits that are repatriated to the country of origin are counted against the country’s GNI but not against its GDP.
  • GNI, therefore, is a better measure of economic well-being than GDP for countries that have large foreign receivables or outlays.

Hence, the correct answer is the national income is net national product at factor cost.



सही उत्तर कारक लागत पर नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद है।

 Key Points

  • कारक लागत पर NNP (कारक लागत पर नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद) देश के सामान्य लोगों द्वारा उत्पादित सभी वस्तुओं और सेवाओं का नेट मौद्रिक मूल्य होती है।
  • कारक लागत पर NNP में भारत में या भारत के बाहर रहने वाले भारतीय नागरिकों द्वारा अर्जित धन शामिल होता है। 
  • कारक लागत का NNP = कारक लागत पर NDP + नेट विदेशी कारक आय।
  • एक अर्थव्यवस्था का नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद (NNP) GNP (-) 'मूल्यह्रास' हानि होती है। इसकी गणना करने का सूत्र इस प्रकार है: NNP = GDP - मूल्यह्रास

Additional Information

  • सकल राष्ट्रीय आय (GNI), देश के सकल घरेलू उत्पाद (GDP) और विदेशों से प्राप्त नेट आय (धनात्मक याऋणात्मक) का योग होता है।
  • उदाहरण के लिए, जिस देश में कई विदेशी व्यवसाय संचालित होते हैं, GNI, GDP से बहुत छोटा होता है, क्योंकि मूल देश में प्रत्यावर्तित विदेशी व्यवसायों के मुनाफे को देश के GNI के विरुद्ध गिना जाता है, लेकिन इसके GDP के विरुद्ध नहीं।
  • GNI, इसलिए, बड़े विदेशी प्राप्य या परिव्यय वाले देशों के लिए GDP की तुलना में आर्थिक कल्याण का एक बेहतर उपाय है।

अतः, सही उत्तर यह है कि राष्ट्रीय आय कारक लागत पर नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद है।

quiz.text:
Where in India is the first indigenously built atomic power plant located?
भारत में पहला स्वदेश निर्मित परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र कहाँ स्थित है?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Kalpakkam.

Key Points

  • India's first fully indigenously constructed nuclear power station is Madras Atomic Power Station (MAPS), which is located in Kalpakkam(Tamil Nadu).

Additional Information

Name of Atomic Station Location State
Madras Atomic Power Station Kalpakkam Tamil Nadu
Tarapur Atomic Power Station Tarapur Maharashtra
Kaiga Nuclear Power Plant Kaiga Karnataka
Kakrapar Atomic Power Station Kakrapar Gujarat
Rajasthan Atomic Power Station Rawatbhata Rajasthan



सही उत्तर कलपक्कम है।

Key Points

  • भारत का पहला पूर्णतः स्वदेश निर्मित परमाणु ऊर्जा स्टेशन मद्रास नाभिकीय ऊर्जा संयंत्र (एमएपीएस) है, जो कलपक्कम (तमिलनाडु) में स्थित है।

Additional Information

परमाणु संयंत्र का नाम स्थान राज्य
मद्रास परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र कलपक्कम तमिलनाडु
तारापुर परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र तारापुर महाराष्ट्र
कैगा परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र कैगा कर्नाटक
काकरापार परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र काकरापार गुजरात
राजस्थान परमाणु ऊर्जा संयंत्र रावतभाटा राजस्थान

quiz.text:
As per the Census data, What was the density of population in India in 2011?
जनगणना के आंकड़ों के अनुसार, 2011 में भारत में जनसंख्या का घनत्व कितना था?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 382 persons/sq km.

Key Points

  •  India is one of the most densely populated countries in the world.
  • The population density of India as per the 2011 Census was 382 persons per square kilometer.
  • The worldwide average population density was approximately 15 people per sq. km.
  • Bihar has the highest population density (1106 people per square kilometer), followed by Bengal (1028) and Kerala (860).
  • The state with the lowest population density is Arunachal Pradesh (17 persons/sq) and the Union Territory with the lowest density of population is Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

Additional Information

  • The Census of India 2011 was organized in two stages trails of House listing and Housing Census and Population Enumeration.
  • The population of India has been augmented by more than 181 million during the decade 2001-2011.
  • As per the 2011 Census population report of India is pegged at 1.21 billion, a surge of more than 181 million in the last 10 years.

 Highlights of the 2011 Census of India

  • The population of the nation as per the provisional figures of Census 2011 is 1210.19 million of which 623.7 million (51.54%) are males and 586.46 million (48.46%) are females.
  • Uttar Pradesh is the most populous state in India its population is more than the population of Brazil.
Literacy rate in India The overall literacy rate in India is 74% 
Highest Literacy rate Kerala, with a literacy of 96.2%
Lowest Literacy rate Bihar, with a literacy of 61.80%
Sex ratio in India  The sex ratio in India is 940 females per 1000 males
Urban population 31.165 % of the total population can be categorized under the Urban population
Highest population Uttar Pradesh (approximately 20 crores)
Least population  Sikkim with a population of 6.71 lakhs.
Highest urban population Goa is the most urbanized state with 62.17% of the population living in urban areas.
The state of India has a negative population growth rate Nagaland


सही उत्तर 382 व्यक्ति/वर्ग किमी है।

Key Points

  • भारत विश्व के सबसे घनी आबादी वाले देशों में से एक है।
  • 2011 की जनगणना के अनुसार भारत का जनसंख्या घनत्व 382 व्यक्ति प्रति वर्ग किलोमीटर था।
  • विश्व भर में औसत जनसंख्या घनत्व लगभग 15 व्यक्ति प्रति वर्ग किमी था।
  • बिहार में सबसे अधिक जनसंख्या घनत्व (1106 लोग प्रति वर्ग किलोमीटर) है, इसके बाद बंगाल (1028) और केरल (860) हैं।
  • सबसे कम जनसंख्या घनत्व वाला राज्य अरुणाचल प्रदेश (17 व्यक्ति/वर्ग) है और सबसे कम जनसंख्या घनत्व वाला केंद्र शासित प्रदेश अंडमान और निकोबार द्वीप समूह है।

Additional Information

  • भारत की जनगणना 2011 को आवास सूची और आवासीय जनगणना और जनसंख्या गणना के दो चरणों में आयोजित किया गया था।
  • 2001-2011 के दशक के दौरान भारत की जनसंख्या में 181 मिलियन से अधिक की वृद्धि हुई है।
  • 2011 की जनगणना के अनुसार भारत की जनसंख्या 1.21 बिलियन आंकी गई है, जो पिछले 10 वर्षों में 181 मिलियन से अधिक की वृद्धि है।

2011 की भारत की जनगणना की मुख्य विशेषताएं

  • 2011 की जनगणना के अनंतिम आंकड़ों के अनुसार देश की जनसंख्या 1210.19 मिलियन है, जिसमें 623.7 मिलियन (51.54%) पुरुष और 586.46 मिलियन (48.46%) महिलाएं हैं।
  • उत्तर प्रदेश भारत का सबसे अधिक जनसंख्या वाला राज्य है इसकी जनसंख्या ब्राजील की जनसंख्या से भी अधिक है।
भारत में साक्षरता दर  भारत में समग्र साक्षरता दर 74% है
उच्चतम साक्षरता दर  केरल में 96.2% साक्षरता दर है
सबसे कम साक्षरता दर  बिहार में 61.80% साक्षरता दर है
भारत में लिंग अनुपात  भारत में लिंगानुपात प्रति 1000 पुरुषों पर 940 महिलाएं हैं
शहरी आबादी  कुल आबादी का 31.165% शहरी आबादी के तहत वर्गीकृत किया जा सकता है

सर्वाधिक जनसंख्या		 उत्तर प्रदेश (लगभग 20 करोड़)
सबसे कम आबादी सिक्किम जिसकी आबादी 6.71 लाख है।
सबसे अधिक शहरी आबादी गोवा शहरी क्षेत्रों में रहने वाली 62.17% आबादी के साथ सबसे अधिक शहरीकृत राज्य है।.
भारत के राज्य में नकारात्मक जनसंख्या वृद्धि दर है नागालैंड

quiz.text:
Chenab, the largest tributary of the Indus, is formed by which of the following two streams?
सिंधु की सबसे बड़ी सहायक नदी चिनाब निम्नलिखित में से किन दो धाराओं से बनती है?
options:
(A) Mandakini and Prabha
(A) मंदाकिनी और प्रभा

(B) The Chandra and the Bhaga
(B) चंद्रा और भागा

(C) The Bhaga and the Mandakini
(C) भागा और मंदाकिनी

(D) The Chandra and the Prabha
(D) चंद्रा और प्रभा
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is The Chandra and the Bhaga.Key Points

  • The Chenab River is a major river that flows in India and Pakistan, and is one of the 5 major rivers of the Punjab region.
  • It is formed by the union of two headwaters, Chandra and Bhaga, which rise in the upper Himalayas in the Lahaul region of Himachal Pradesh, India.
  • The Chenab flows through the Jammu region of Jammu and Kashmir, India into the plains of Punjab, Pakistan, before ultimately flowing into the Indus River.
  • The waters of the Chenab were allocated to Pakistan under the terms of the Indus Waters Treaty (signed in 1960).
  • India is allowed non-consumptive uses such as power generation.
  • The Chenab River is extensively used in Pakistan for irrigation.
  • Its waters are also transferred to the channel of the Ravi River via numerous link canals.



सही उत्तर चंद्रा और भागा है।

 Key Points

  • चिनाब नदी एक प्रमुख नदी है जो भारत और पाकिस्तान में बहती है, और पंजाब क्षेत्र की 5 प्रमुख नदियों में से एक है।
  • यह दो प्रमुख धाराओं, चंद्रा और भागा के मिलन से बनती है, जो भारत के हिमाचल प्रदेश के लाहौल क्षेत्र में ऊपरी हिमालय से निकलती है।
  • चिनाब अंततः सिंधु नदी में बहने से पहले, जम्मू और कश्मीर, भारत के जम्मू क्षेत्र से होकर पंजाब, पाकिस्तान के मैदानी इलाकों में बहती है।
  • सिंधु जल संधि (1960 में हस्ताक्षरित) की शर्तों के तहत चिनाब का पानी पाकिस्तान को आवंटित किया गया था।
  • भारत को बिजली उत्पादन जैसे गैर-उपभोग्य उपयोगों की अनुमति है।
  • चिनाब नदी का उपयोग पाकिस्तान में सिंचाई के लिए बड़े पैमाने पर किया जाता है।
  • इसके जल को कई लिंक नहरों के माध्यम से रावी नदी के चैनल में भी स्थानांतरित किया जाता है।

quiz.text:
The reign of Raja Krishnadev Raya is considered the golden age of which literary language?
राजा कृष्णदेव राय के शासनकाल को किस साहित्यिक भाषा का स्वर्ण युग माना जाता है?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Telugu.

Important Points

  • Vijayanagar empire was established in 1336 by Harihara I and his brother Bukka Raya I of the Sangama Dynasty.
  • The Vijayanagar emperors were great patrons of art and literature.
  • The Ashtadiggajas were the eight great poets in the court of the Vijayanagar king Krishnadeva Raya who ruled the Vijayanagara Empire from 1509 until his death in 1529.
  • The rule of Krishna Deva Raya is known as the golden age of Telugu literature.
  • The Ashtadiggajas are:
    • Allasani Peddana was revered as Andhra Kavita Pitamahudu (the grand father of Telugu poetry).
    • Nandi Thimmana wrote Parijataapaharanam, he was called Mukku Thimmana (Thimmana of the nose).
    • Madayyagari Mallana wrote Rajasekhara Charitram.
    • Dhurjati Kalahasti Mahatyamu.
    • Ayyalaraju Ramambhadrudu wrote Ramaabhyudayamu.
    • Pingali Surana wrote Raghavapandaveeyamu, a dual work that describes both Ramayana and Mahabharata
    • Ramarajabhushanudu wrote Kavyalankarasangrahamu, Vasucharitramu and Harischandranalopakhyanamu.
    • Tenali Ramakrishna wrote Udbhataradhya Charitramu, Panduranga Mahatmyamu, and Ghatikachala Mahatmyamu. He was also a minister of the court.


सही उत्तर तेलुगू है। 

Important Points

  • विजयनगर साम्राज्य की स्थापना 1336 में संगम वंश के हरिहर प्रथम और उनके भाई बुक्का राय प्रथम ने की थी। 
  • विजयनगर के शासक कला और साहित्य के महान संरक्षक थे।
  • विजयनगर के राजा कृष्णदेव राय ने 1509 से 1529 में अपनी मृत्यु तक विजयनगर साम्राज्य पर शासन किया था। उनके दरबार में आठ महान कवि (अष्टदिग्गज) थे।
  • कृष्णदेव राय के शासन को तेलुगु साहित्य के स्वर्ण युग के रूप में जाना जाता है।
  • अष्टदिग्गज निम्नलिखित हैं:
    • अल्लासानी पेद्दाना, आंध्र कविता पितामहुडु (तेलुगू कविता के पितामह) के रूप में प्रतिष्ठित थे।
    • नंदी थिम्मन ने पारिजातपहरनमु की रचना की थी। मुक्कू थिम्माना (नाक का थिम्माना) के नाम से संबोधित किया जाता था।
    • मदय्यागरी मल्लाना ने राजशेखर चरित्रम् की रचना की।
    • धुर्जती कालाहस्ती महात्यमु।
    • अय्यालराजू रामभद्रुदु ने रामाभ्युदयमु लिखा था।
    • पिंगली सुरन्ना ने राघवपाण्डवीयम् की रचना की थी। यह एक ऐसी रचना है जिसमें रामायण और महाभारत दोनों का वर्णन है। 
    • रामराजाभूषणुडु ने काव्यालंकरसंग्रहमु, वसुचरित्रमु और हरिश्चंद्रनलोपख्यानमु की रचना की थी।
    • तेनाली रामकृष्ण ने उद्भताराध्या चरित्रमु, पांडुरंग महात्म्यमु और घटिकाचल महात्म्यमु की रचना की थी। वे दरबार के मंत्री भी थे।

quiz.text:
Who among the following was not a leader of the moderates?
निम्नलिखित में से कौन नरमपंथियों का नेता नहीं था?
options:
(C) Gopal Krishna Gokhale
(C) गोपाल कृष्ण गोखले
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Aurobindo Ghosh.

Key Points

  • Foundation Of Indian National Congress (INC)
    • The Indian National Congress was founded by AO Hume during the reign of Governor-General Lord Dufferin.
    • Its 1st session was held at Bombay in 1885 under the presidency of W C Banerjee
    • The Congress split into two parts-Moderates and Extremists in the year 1907 at the Surat Session of INC
    • It was also popularly known as 'Surat Split'

Additional Information

  • Comparison between Moderates and Extremists leadership

Extremists

Period

1885-1905

1905-1919

Methodology

They follow the principles of 3P: Petition, Prayer and Protest

They believe in militant methods

Ideology

They believe in the efficacy of peaceful and constitutional agitation

They were radical in their approach

Leaders

W.C. Banerjee. Surendra Nath Banerjee, Dadabhai Naoroji, Feroze Shah Mehta. Gopalakrishna Gokhale. Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya. Badruddin Tyabji. Justice Ranade and G.Subramanya Aiyar

Lala Lajpat Rai, Lokmanya Bal Gangadhar Tilak. Bipin Chandra Pal, Aurobindo Ghose Rajnarayan Bose, and  Ashwini Kumar Dutt


सही उत्‍तर अरबिंदो घोष है।

Key Points

  • भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेस की स्थापना (INC)
    • भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेस की स्थापना ए.ओ. ह्यूम ने गवर्नर-जनरल लॉर्ड डफरिन के शासनकाल के दौरान की थी।
    • इसका पहला सत्र 1885 में डब्ल्यू. सी. बनर्जी की अध्यक्षता में बॉम्बे में आयोजित किया गया था।
    • वर्ष 1907 में कांग्रेस के सूरत अधिवेशन में कांग्रेस दो भागों में विभाजित हो गई- नरमपंथी और चरमपंथी
    • इसे 'सूरत विभाजन' के नाम से भी जाना जाता था।​

Additional Information

  • नरमपंथी और गरमपंथी नेतृत्व के बीच तुलना

चरण

नरमपंथी

गरमपंथी

अवधि

1885-1905

1905-1919

क्रियाविधि

ये 3P के सिद्धांतों का पालन करते हैं: याचिका(Petition), प्रार्थना(Prayer) और विरोध(Protest)

ये उग्रवादी तरीकों में विश्वास करते हैं

विचारधारा

ये शांतिपूर्ण और संवैधानिक आंदोलन की प्रभावशीलता में विश्वास करते हैं

ये अपने दृष्टिकोण में कट्टरपंथी थे

नेता

डब्ल्यू.सी.बनर्जी, सुरेंद्र नाथ बनर्जी, दादाभाई नौरोजी, फिरोज शाह मेहता, गोपालकृष्ण गोखले, पंडित मदन मोहन मालवीय, बदरुद्दीन तैयबजी,  न्यायमूर्ति रानाडे और जी.सुब्रमण्य अय्यर

लाला लाजपत राय, लोकमान्य बाल गंगाधर तिलक,  बिपिन चंद्र पाल, अरबिंदो घोष, राजनारायण बोस, और अश्विनी कुमार दत्त

quiz.text:
India’s National Song was a part of Bankimchandra Chatterji's novel ______.
भारत का राष्ट्रीय गीत बंकिमचंद्र चटर्जी के उपन्यास ______ का एक हिस्सा था।
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Anand Math.

Key Points

  • Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay wrote the national song 'Vande Mataram', which was a part of his novel Anandamath (1882).
  • It is a political novel depicting a Sanyasi army fighting the British soldiers.
  • The poem was first sung by Rabindranath Tagore in the 1896 session of the Indian National Congress.
  • The first two verses of the song were adopted as the National Song of India in October 1937 by the Congress Working Committee prior to the end of colonial rule in August 1947.
  • On 24 January 1950, the Constituent Assembly of India has adopted "Vande Mataram" as a national song.
  • On the occasion, the first President of India, Rajendra Prasad stated that the song should be honoured equally with the national anthem of India, "Jana Gana Mana".​

Additional Information

  • Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay was born on June 27, 1838, in Naihati in West Bengal to an orthodox Bengali Brahmin family.
  • Durgeshnandini (1865) and Kapalkundala (1866) were his first major publications.
  • Both the novels were well received and translated into other languages as well.
  • Devi Chaudhurani is a Bengali novel written by Bankim Chandra Chatterji and published in 1884.​
  • Bankim was critical of British rule and often used to criticize the government in his writings and publications.
  • Bankim Chandra died on April 8, 1894.
  • In his lifetime, he wrote numerous novels, stories, and essays, and his works were translated into several languages.

​



सही उत्तर आनंद मठ है।

Key Points

  • बंकिम चंद्र चट्टोपाध्याय ने राष्ट्रीय गीत 'वंदे मातरम' लिखा, जो उनके उपन्यास आनंदमठ (1882) का एक हिस्सा था।
  • यह एक राजनीतिक उपन्यास है जिसमें एक संन्यासी सेना को ब्रिटिश सैनिकों से लड़ते हुए दर्शाया गया है।
  • कविता को पहली बार रवींद्रनाथ टैगोर ने भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेस के 1896 के सत्र में गाया था।
  • अगस्त 1947 में औपनिवेशिक शासन की समाप्ति से पहले कांग्रेस कार्य समिति द्वारा अक्टूबर 1937 में गीत के पहले दो छंदों को भारत के राष्ट्रीय गीत के रूप में अपनाया गया था।
  • 24 जनवरी 1950 को, भारत की संविधान सभा ने "वंदे मातरम" को एक राष्ट्रीय गीत के रूप में अपनाया है।
  • इस अवसर पर, भारत के पहले राष्ट्रपति राजेंद्र प्रसाद ने कहा कि गीत को भारत के राष्ट्रगान, "जन गण मन" के साथ समान रूप से सम्मानित किया जाना चाहिए।.
